title: Can you sell content (like music) that is in public domain and how so (legally)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure, you can sell public domain content. For example, people buy eBooks that are in the public domain because they are better formatted than the free equivalent found on a site like Gutenberg.org You don't even need a meaningful value proposition. Really, your potential customer probably won't even know you're selling public domain content. But you can't claim ownership/copyright of such content.

If it is in the public domain, it can be sold. But who would buy something that they can get for free? The challenge is coming up with a reason that people would pay you for it, such as the medium it is being provided on or some other special aspect of it.
